forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind around 12 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the city is enveloped in a shroud of gray clouds, lending an almost ethereal quality to the landscape. The winds carry a crisp chill, keeping the temperature hovering comfortably but cool. The forecast hints at a mostly cloudy night, with temperatures expected to dip slightly. If you venture outside, a light jacket will serve as your best companion against the wind, which promises playful gusts that dance about ten to sixteen miles per hour, occasionally rising to twenty-one, rustling leaves and whispering secrets of the bay.

The day itself was marked by a flirtation with the sun, though clouds persisted, casting a soft diffused light over the surroundings. High temperatures reached near sixty, before graciously regressing to a gentle fifty-six, all while the West wind continued its rhythmic embrace. While the city may seem obscured right now, the air is fresh and invigorating, perfect for a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or perhaps a quiet sit in one of the parks dotted around the area, where local fruit stands offer seasonal delights. Should you wish for more activity, a cozy coffee shop might call to your senses, where the warmth of a fresh brew could wrap around you like a comforting afghan, making the most of what this unexpected haziness has to offer.
